;习近平主席与联合国两国总统乔·拜登周三在加利福尼亚州旧金山以南的历史庄园菲罗利举行会晤。

;

; 习近平主席和美国总统乔·拜登周三会晤，同意加强各领域对话与合作双方承诺启动人工智能政府间对话、加强禁毒合作、共同应对气候危机。

;

; 这些共识是世界两大经济体领导人在会晤期间达成的。在加利福尼亚州旧金山以南的一座历史悠久的庄园 Filoli 举行了长达数小时的会议。峰会包括多场会议、工作午餐和午餐后的短暂散步。

;

; 两国元首同意在平等和尊重的基础上恢复两军高层交往。这包括中美防务政策协调会谈和中美军事海上磋商协议会议，以及战区指挥官之间的电话交谈。

;

; 双方还同意致力于大幅增加预定的明年初开通客运航班，扩大教育、学生、青年、文化、体育和商业交流。

;

; 他们对北京和华盛顿气候特使最近进行的积极讨论表示欢迎。其中包括 2020 年代国家级减排行动计划、成功举办第 28 届联合国气候变化框架公约缔约方大会（COP28）的共同方法，以及在 2020 年代启动加强气候行动工作组。

;

; 两国元首还强调了两国相互尊重、找到和平相处之道的重要性。此外，他们强调保持开放的沟通渠道，预防冲突，维护《联合国宪章》，在共同利益领域开展合作，并负责任地管理关系中的竞争性方面。

;

; 在习近平访问期间，这是他六年来首次访美，他告诉拜登，在全球百年未有之大变局的时代，中美有两种选择。一是加强团结合作，携手应对全球性挑战，促进全球安全与繁荣。另一种是固守零和思维，挑起竞争和对抗，使世界走向动荡和分裂。

;

; 这两种选择指向两个不同的方向，将决定人类的未来和发展。习近平表示，“对于中国和美国这样的两个大国来说，背弃对方不是一个选择”。

;

; “一方改造另一方是不现实的。”冲突和对抗都会给双方带来难以承受的后果。”习近平补充道。

;

;他接着说，大国竞争不是时代潮流，解决不了中美乃至世界面临的问题。

;

; “地球足够大，足以让两国取得成功，而一个国家的成功对另一个国家来说是一个机会，”

;

; 习近平表示，中国在推进中国现代化道路的过程中，不会走殖民掠夺的老路，也不会走国强称霸的错误道路。他补充说，中国不输出意识形态，不与任何国家进行意识形态对抗。

;

; 习近平表示，中国无意超越美国、取代美国，同样，美国也不应图谋超越美国。打压或遏制中国。

;

; 只要双方相互尊重、和平共处、合作共赢，两国完全有能力超越分歧，找到正确的相处之路，

;

; 习近平回顾去年拜登在印尼巴厘岛会晤时作出的承诺，强调北京和华盛顿有必要树立新愿景，打造中美关系五个支柱。

;

; 他说，第一个支柱是共同培养对彼此的正确认识。北京始终致力于与华盛顿建立稳定、健康和可持续的关系。同时，中方也有必须维护的利益、必须坚持的原则、不能逾越的红线。

;

; 其次，他呼吁两国有效管控分歧，并表示双方应寻求共同利益。搭建桥梁，让彼此相向而行。中美双方应相互尊重原则和红线，不搞出尔反尔、不挑衅、不逾越底线。

;

; 三是共同努力，共同进步。习近平指出，中美两国在经贸、农业等传统领域以及气候变化、人工智能等新兴领域拥有广泛共同利益。

;

; 双方要充分利用外交政策、经济、金融、商务、农业等领域恢复和新的机制，开展禁毒、司法、执法、他补充说，人工智能和科学技术。

;

; 第四，习近平呼吁双方共同承担大国责任，表示要以身作则，加强在国际和地区问题上的协调与合作，为世界提供更多公共产品。

;

; 他还呼吁加强人文交流，这是第五支柱。

;

; 习近平阐述了中国的发展中方在台湾问题上的原则立场，呼吁美方以实际行动兑现不支持“台独”、停止武装台湾、支持和平统一的承诺。

;

; 中国一定会实现统一，他强调，这是不可阻挡的。

;

; 他还表示，美国针对中国的出口管制、投资审查、单边制裁等行为严重损害了中国的正当利益。

;

;他说，中国的技术进步无非是遏制国家高质量发展、剥夺中国人民的发展权。

;

; 重要的是，美方认真对待中方关切，采取切实举措解除单边制裁，为中国企业提供平等、公正、非歧视的环境。

;

; 拜登在峰会开幕致辞拜登表示，他与习近平的会晤一直是“坦诚、直接、有益的”。

;

; 拜登重申了他在巴厘岛做出的五项承诺，表示美国不寻求新冷战，不寻求新冷战。美国致力于改变中国的制度，不谋求重振反华联盟，不支持“台独”，无意与中国发生冲突。

;

; 美国坚持拜登表示，奉行一个中国政策。

;

; 拜登表示，美中关系是世界上最重要的双边关系，一个稳定、发展的中国符合美国和整个地球的利益，中国经济增长有利于美国，也有利于世界。

;

;美国乐见中国的发展繁荣，无意阻止中国的发展。 39、发展经济或遏制中国，或谋求“脱钩”他补充说，来自中国。

;

;

;王表示，双方就“20多个”议题达成共识。中美领导人会晤期间的议题涉及政治、外交、人文交流、全球治理、军事安全等领域。

;国家元首会议，而其他一些内容是在会议期间谈判并最终确定的。”

; “这七点很重要，将为双方下一步深入讨论奠定坚实的基础。”

; < p>;中国关系的基础是我们的人民奠定的。二战期间，我们两国为和平与正义并肩作战。在陈纳德将军的带领下，一支被称为“飞虎队”的美国志愿军奔赴中国战场。他们不仅参与了与日本侵略者作斗争的直接战斗，而且还创造了“驼峰”。空运将急需的物资运送到中国。 1000多名中美飞行员在这条航线上丧生。日本偷袭珍珠港后，美国于 1942 年派出 16 架 B-25 轰炸机对日本进行空袭。完成任务后，由于燃料不足，詹姆斯·杜利特尔中校和他的飞行员战友在中国跳伞。他们被中国军队和当地民众救起。但是约有25万平民被日本侵略者杀害。

;

; Cooperation on climate change has historically been one of the most constructive aspects of US-China relations, and there are many ways for both sides to re-envision cooperation amid tensions over other issues, experts said.

;

; "We really can't address this issue (climate change) without both the United States and China acting. We're the largest emitters in the world, and the rest of the world looks closely at the US-China bilateral relationship when it comes to climate change," said Joanna Lewis, a climate expert at Georgetown University.

;

; In the months leading up to the Paris Agreement, it was the US-China bilateral relationship and both countries' pledges to act that mobilized global action, said Lewis, an associate professor of energy and environment and director of the university's Science, Technology and International Affairs Program.

;

; The latest example was the meeting between China's special envoy for climate change Xie Zhenhua and his US counterpart John Kerry in California this month, ahead of the 28th United Nations Climate Change Conference in Dubai. The aim of the dialogue was to foster cooperation and promote a successful COP28.

;

; Lewis said reports indicated the meeting was constructive and set the stage for some re-engagement on climate. "Hours after that meeting, China released a long-awaited national methane plan, which is the first time China's released any policy strategy related to a very potent greenhouse gas that is key to the solution," Lewis said at a panel discussion examining US-China relations.

;

; The plan said China would focus on improving its monitoring and supervision systems for methane through 2030.

;

; Methane is a short-lived greenhouse gas with more than 80 times the global warming impact of carbon dioxide over a 20-year period. Reducing methane emissions is key to slowing short-term climate change and managing air pollution hazards, according to the California-China Climate Institute at the University of California, Berkeley.

;

; Together with China's Ministry of Science and Technology, the US-based advocacy group Environmental Defense Fund launched the China-US Track 2 methane science and technology collaboration platform this year. The platform helps facilitate collaboration and exchanges among top methane science and research experts in both countries, according to Zhang Xiaonan, the group's methane manager.

;

; "Two symposiums have been convened so far, which provided precious opportunities for direct communications between Chinese and US methane experts," said Zhang.

;

; Methane has been "a big focus of the current administration and its engagement with China", said Lewis, and climate cooperation could be one of the ways to "re-envision the relationship under the current political climate".

;

; Other experts expressed similar optimism, including Jake Werner, acting director of the East Asia program at the Quincy Institute, a Washington-based think tank.

;

; Using California Governor Gavin Newsom's recent climate-themed trip to China as an example, Werner said, "It shows a different and hopeful way to conduct diplomacy." During his visit, the governor renewed four existing California climate cooperation agreements with Chinese provinces and municipalities and signed a new one.

;

; "Establishing an architecture that embodies a mutually recognized common good is essential to US interests because it would facilitate both healthy competition and healthy cooperation with China," said Werner in a report on US-China relations.

;

; The US and China have been cooperating with each other for decades on clean energy and climate change, which has been "one of the most constructive aspects of the relationship", said Lewis. The cornerstone of US-China climate cooperation is based on clean energy technology, accelerating innovation and deployment, she said.

;

; "Over the past few decades, China has risen to become the leading manufacturer and deployer of most of the key clean energy technologies that the world needs for the low carbon transition — wind, solar, and now batteries for electric vehicles," she said, and this has created a competitive environment.

;

; "No cooperation, particularly on the science and technology front, is ultimately detrimental to the US and to the global innovation system."

;

; Fan Dai, director of the California-China Climate Institute, told China Daily it is important for the two countries to work together on global challenges, particularly climate change, as neither country can solve the issue on its own.

;

; "Beyond the G20, there are areas in climate finance the two countries can cooperate on, such as providing funding resources for developing countries, African countries and poor communities to allow access to renewable energy and accelerate the clean energy transition in these areas and regions," Fan said.

;

; Another area for cooperation could be enhancing carbon emission disclosure requirements and aligning on climate-resilient investment guidelines to help mobilize financial resources for climate initiatives, Fan added.

;

; Zhang Jianyu, executive director of the BRI Green Development Institute, said China and the US should maximize the convergence of interests by enhancing collaboration in developing countries. These nations, which have less capability to deal with climate change, represent the major contradiction in global efforts to cope with the issue.

;

; One viable option to jointly address the problem is to establish cooperation between China' s Green Investment and Finance Partnership and the Just Energy Transition Partnership in the West, he said, adding the two mechanisms should complement each other.

;

; While the JETP provides financing to developing states mainly to shut down fossil fuel plants , the GIFP focuses on enabling developing countries to foster investment and build new clean power sources for sustainable energy growth.
